properties.markdownProperty:
When implementing the symbolic link archetype, an issue was identified that affected the correct generation of HTML. If the template of each object referenced by a symbolic link is called to be rereferenced, this template will again generate an HTML code snippet with an "id" attribute.
In an HTML document there should not be two tags with the same identifier, which makes the generated code not correct according to the standards. Duplicate IDs also affect how navigation works within the document. If there is a repeated identifier, it is always navigated to the first match, which may not be the original object but a symbolic representation of it.
